title: Thoughts about 2 runes
body:
These are just some thoughts i want to share with the community, hoping to start a good discussion and possibly allow Riot to think about the following 2 runes and maybe improve them:

Rune: Celestial body
Effect: +100 hp, -10% dmg vs monsters until minute 10
Status: Removed

I think this was a good rune. Pretty underrated too. Sure, you have lose dmg against monsters for the first 10 minutes, but i think the point was to prevent jungler to use this rune, since +100 hp at lvl 1 for free on a jungler (IN MY OPINION) is a bit too much. On support and tanks, however, it can make wonders, allowing you to be harder to be poked out of lane and allows you to create a bit more pressure. I heard people complaining about the passive gameplay this rune favors (or the fact that a simple stat boost is not fun) and i can somewhat understand it, but i think it's possible to work around this rune to make it worth it.
I would advice something like this:

+100 hp from the start, +X hp every minute after that (first bonus at minute 11)
-10% dmg vs monsters until minute 10

This was suggested in another thread and i think this alone would help it make it worth for the tanks.
Another option (this one is mine) i can suggest is:

Gain 100 (+50 per stack) permanent hp. Earn a stack the first time you get a takedown on each enemy champion.
-10% dmg against monsters until minute 10

This should make it a bit more interesting, capping at 350 hp once you get all the stacks. I'm not too sure if it's a lot or not, but in case it is it's still possible to lower it to 25 hp per stack, reaching a total of 225 hp.

Another alternative could be:

+10 max hp every minute (first bonus at 1 minute)
-10% dmg vs monsters
Gain adaptive damage based on your total hp (0.5 AD or 1 AP every 100 hp)

This will open up some more build for the tanks, while helping supports with their skills. Let's suppose a Sona support reaches 2000 hp (extremely possible). That's 20 AP, which may not seem a lot, but it really helps. A tank with 3000 hp would gain 30 AP (or 15 AD).


Rune: Font of life
Effect: Enemy champions whose movement you impair are marked for 4 seconds. Allied champions attacking marked targets regenerate 5 (+1% your max hp) over 2 seconds.

In my opinion, this is a bit low by itself. Let's suppose you play a tank and reach 3.1k hp. That's 31 + 5 = 36 hp regenerated. Suppose half of that is regenerated immediately and the other half over 2 seconds. So 16 immediately, then 8, then 8 again. An ally hit the target 4 times over the course of the 4 seconds, resetting the 2 second duration.
16 X 4 = 64
8 X 4 = 32
(here there is the next AA, which means only the last auto complete the 2 second regeneration time)
8 X 1 = 8

Total is 104 hp. Sure, you can increase this with runes/items increasing the healing done, but let's work without those for a minute.
104 hp in the span of 6 seconds (1 hit each second, 4 seconds mark, 2 seconds to complete the last regen cycle ) is 17.3333 hp/sec.
So, without items/runes that's not really something worth, especially if you consider that normally a tank can reach 3.1k hp near late game, where ADCs can dish out at least 2 times that dmg with a single AA.
In my opinion, this rune needs a small buff. Maybe something like 1 second regen instead of 2? Or increase the healing to 2.5% / 5% max hp depending if the owner is ranged or melee?
What are your opinions?
